sentences.english: The girl, obviously smitten herself, is afraid the boy will see her looking at him.
sentences.chinese: 女孩，顯然地已墜入情網，很怕男孩看到自己在看他。

sentences.english: My world is silent silent, cannot hold others.
sentences.chinese: 陷入情網的人是無法理智的。

sentences.english: I have always been intrigued about the phrases “falling in love” and “falling head over heels” in love.
sentences.chinese: 我一直好奇“墜入愛河”和“墮入情網”等相關短語。

sentences.english: He had himself never been in love before.
sentences.chinese: 他以前從沒有墮入過情網。

sentences.english: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person. (Mignon McLaughlin)
sentences.chinese: 成功的婚姻總是多次墜入情網，但鍾情於同一人。

sentences.english: Couples who had just fallen in love had significantly higher levels of nerve growth factor, or NGF.
sentences.chinese: 剛剛墜入情網的戀人明顯有較高水平的神經生長因子。

sentences.english: Fan Chen, we are men and women, can not earn a tangle of love.
sentences.chinese: 我們都是凡塵男女，掙不出糾纏的情網。

sentences.english: When I fell in love, I realised for the first time that I was lovable.
sentences.chinese: 當我墜入情網時，我才第一次發現我是會被人愛上的。

sentences.english: She fell in love with the country and its people.
sentences.chinese: 與國家和它的人她墮入情網了。

sentences.english: You're the one with whom I have fallen in love with.
sentences.chinese: 你就是令我陷入情網的那個人。

sentences.english: When falling in love, some lose their head.
sentences.chinese: 陷入情網旳時候，有一些人丟暸腦袋。

sentences.english: What do you get when you fall in love?
sentences.chinese: 當你墜入情網的時候你得到了什麼？

sentences.english: Women fall in love through their ear, and men through their eyes.
sentences.chinese: 情話會使女人墜入情網，男人則是因爲眼中的美麗。

sentences.english: Sometimes people say they just fall in love too frequently.
sentences.chinese: 人們有時會說她們會輕易的墜入情網。

sentences.english: Maria was so much in love with Jose, and she wanted to marry him.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗亞跟荷西墜入了情網並且論及了婚嫁。

definition: loss of love/breakup of a relationship
just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
